place.name: LLANISHEN
place.gazetteerText: LLANISHEN, a parish in the district and county of Monmouth; near Olway brook, 4 miles E by S of Llandenny r. station, and 6½ SSW of Monmouth. Posttown, Chepstow. Acres, 1,742. Real property, £1,904. Pop., 320. Houses, 72. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £64. Patron, the Duke of Beaufort. The church is good. Charities, £22. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
